DOC.HEAD: Snow Credited With Protecting Wheat Crop
DOC.TEXT: The government's Joint Agricultural Weather Facility said Wednesday that snow cover helped protect winter wheat from the severe cold over much of the central and northern Great Plains and the Corn Belt. ``Cold temperatures and lack of moisture stressed winter wheat in Oklahoma and Texas,'' the report said. ``The extent of the freeze damage was still unknown.'' The report covered the week of Dec. 18-24 and noted that ``a brutal blast of arctic air'' tumbled temperatures to record lows in many areas. Below-normal readings in major citrus and vegetable areas of Florida and Texas cause widespread damage, although losses have not been fully determined, the report said. The facility is operated jointly by the department's of Agriculture and Commerce. Weekly reports cover general crop conditions but do not include production forecasts.
